parse.title: List of modern names for biblical place names

text.*:
While the main Biblical place names like Jerusalem, Athens, Damascus, Alexandria, and Rome have been used for centuries, some have changed through the years.

Contents

  • 1 Old Testament
  • 2 New Testament
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Old Testament[edit]

Biblical name Mentioned in Present name Province/Region Country Name
Ai[1] Joshua 7:2 Khirbet Haiy;[2] others say, Et-Tell[3] Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate Palestinian territories
Almon[4] Joshua 21:18 Khirbet Almit[5] Palestinian territories
Babylon Jeremiah 50:1 - 50:46 Hillah[6] Babil Governorate Iraq
Beth Arbel[7] Hosea 10:14 Irbid[8] Irbid Governorate Jordan
Beth-tappuah[9] Joshua 15:53 Taffuh[10] Hebron Governorate Palestinian territories
Bozrah[11] Amos 1:12 Bouseira[12] Tafilah Governorate Jordan
Chezib[13] Genesis 38:5 Khirbet esh Sheikh Ghazy[14] Jerusalem District Israel
Cuthah[15] II Kings 17:24 Tell Ibrahim[16] Babil Governorate Iraq
Dedan[17] Ezekiel 38:13 Al-'Ula[18] Al Madinah Region Saudi Arabia
Ecbatana[19] Ezra 6:2 Hamadan[20] Hamadan Province Iran
Elim[21] Exodus 16:1 Wadi Gharandel[22] South Sinai Governorate Egypt
Erech[23] Genesis 10:10 Uruk[24] Al Muthanna Governorate Iraq
Etam[25] II Chronicles 11:6 Solomon's Pools[26][27] Bethlehem Governorate Palestinian territories
Gath Joshua 13:3 Ramla[28][29] Central District Israel
Gath-hepher (Gittahhepher)[30] Joshua 19:13; 2 Kings 14:25 Gob'batha of Sepphoris[31] Northerntral District Israel
Gerar[23] Genesis 10:19 Haluza[32] Southern District Israel
Gilo Joshua 15:51 Beit Jala[33][34] Bethlehem Governorate Palestinian territories
Gozan[35] I Chronicles 5:26 Tell Halaf Al Hasakah Governorate Syria
Harosheth Haggoyim[36] Judges 4:13 El Ahwat[37] Haifa District Israel
Hamath[38] II Samuel 8:9 Hama[39] Hama Governorate Syria
Hammath[40] Joshua 19:35 Tiberias[41] Northern District Israel
Hapharaim[42] Joshua 19:19 eṭ Ṭaiyibeh[43] Northern District Israel
Hazezon-tamar[44] Genesis 14:7 Ein Gedi[45] Southern District Israel
Ible'am[46] Joshua 17:11 Khirbet Yebla[47] Northern District Israel
Iron Joshua 19:38 Yaroun[48] Nabatieh Governorate Lebanon
Joppa[49] Jonah 1:3 Jaffa[50] Tel Aviv District Israel
Kadesh[51] Numbers 20:1 Petra[52] Ma'an Governorate Jordan
Kadesh-barnea[53] Deuteronomy 1:2 Tell el-Qudeirat[54] Sinai Peninsula Egypt
Kedesh-naphtali[36] Judges 4:6 Kedesh[55] Northern District Israel
Kir of Moab[56] Isaiah 15:1 Al Karak[57] Karak Governorate Jordan
Kiriath-Jearim Joshua 9:17 Abu Ghosh[58] Jerusalem District Israel
Kitron[59] Judges 1:30 Sepphoris[60] Northern District Israel
Laish/Leshem[61][62] Judges 18:29 & Joshua 19:47 Tel Dan (Banias)[63] Northern District Israel
Medeba[64][65] Numbers 21:30 & Joshua 13:9 Madaba[66] Madaba Governorate Jordan
Nephtoah[67] Joshua 15:9 Lifta[68][69] Jerusalem District Israel
No Ezekiel 30:14 Alexandria[70] Alexandria Governorate Egypt
Noph Isaiah 19:13 Memphis[71][72] Giza Governorate Egypt
No-amon/Thebes[73][74] Ezekiel30:16 & Nahum 3:8 Luxor Luxor Governorate Egypt
Noph Isaiah 19:13 Memphis[71][72] Giza Governorate Egypt
On/Awen[75] Genesis 46:20 Ayn Shams[76] Cairo Governorate Egypt
Ono I Chronicles 8:12 Or Yehuda[77] Central District Israel
Ophir Job 22:24 Sri Lanka[78] Island country Sri Lanka
Ophrah[79] Joshua 18:23 Taybeh[80] Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate Palestinian territories
Pi-beseth/Bubastis[73] Ezekiel 30:17 Tell Basta[81] Al Sharqia Governorate Egypt
Qiryat Arba[82] Joshua 14:15 Hebron[83] Hebron Governorate Palestinian territories
Rabbah[11] Amos 1:14 Amman[84] Amman Governorate Jordan
Rakkath Joshua 19:35 Tiberias[85] Northern District Israel
Sarepta[86][87] I Kings 17:9 & Obadiah 20 Sarafand Southern Governorate Lebanon
Seba (Saba)[88] Psalm 72:10 Meroë[89] River Nile Governorate Sudan
Sheba[90] I Kings 10:1 Ma'rib[91] Ma'rib Governorate Yemen
Shechem Genesis 12:6 Nablus[92] Nablus Governorate Palestinian territories
Shiloah[93] Isaiah 8:6 Silwan Jerusalem Governorate
Shomron (Samaria) I Kings 16:24 Sebaste[94] Nablus Governorate Palestinian territories
Shunem[95] II Kings 4:8; Joshua 19:18 Sulam[96] Northern District Israel
Sin/Pelusium[73] Ezekiel 30:15 Tell el Farama[97] North Sinai Governorate Egypt
Socoh Joshua 15:35 Kh. Shuweika[98] Central District Israel
Susa[99] Nehemiah 1:1 Shush[100] Khūzestān Province Iran
Syene[101][73] Ezekiel 29:10 & 30:6 Aswan[102] Aswan Governorate Egypt
Tadmor[103] II Chronicles 8:4 Palmyra[104][105] Homs Governorate Syria
Tahpanhes[106] Jeremiah 44:1 Tell Defenneh[107] Dakahlia Governorate Egypt
Timnah[108] Judges 14:1 Khirbet Tibneh[109] Central District Israel
Timnath-heres[110] Joshua 19:50 Kifl Haris[111][112][113] Salfit Governorate Palestinian territories
Ur[114][115] Genesis 11:31 & Nehemiah 9:7 Tell el Muqayyar Dhi Qar Governorate Iraq
Zephathah (Zephath)[116] II Chronicles 14:10 Tell es-Safi Central District Israel
Ziddim Joshua 19:35 Hittin[117] Northern District Israel
Zoan[118] Numbers 13:22 Tanis[119] Al Sharqia Governorate Egypt
Zorah Joshua 15:33 Sar'a[120][121] Central District Israel

New Testament[edit]

Biblical name Mentioned in Present name Province/Region Country Name Country Flag
Adramyttium Acts 27:2 Burhaniye Balıkesir Province Turkey
Antioch Acts 11:26 Antakya[122] Hatay Province Turkey
Aphek Acts 23:31 Rosh HaAyin[123] Central District Israel
Assos Acts 20:13 Behramkale[124] Çanakkale Province Turkey
Attalia Acts 14:25 Antalya[125] Antalya Province Turkey
Berea Acts 17:10-13 Veria Imathia Greece
Cauda Acts 27:16 Gavdos Chania Greece
Cenchrea Romans 16:1 Kechries Korinthía Greece
Gerasa Mark 5:1 & Luke 8:26 Jerash[126] Jerash Governorate Jordan
Iconium Acts 14:1 Konya Konya Province Turkey
Lod Acts 9:32 Lod[127] Central District Israel
Lystra Acts 14:8 Klistra[128] Konya Province Turkey
Mitylene Acts 20:14 Mytilene[129] Lesbos Greece
Myra Acts 27:5 Demre[130] Antalya Province Turkey
Neapolis Acts 16:11 Kavala[131] East Macedonia and Thrace Greece
Nicopolis Titus 3:12 Preveza[132] Epirus Greece
Pergamum Revelation 2:12 Bergama İzmir Province Turkey
Philadelphia Revelation 3:7 Alaşehir[133] Manisa Province Turkey
Ptolemais Acts 21:7 Acre Northern District Israel
Puteoli Acts 28:13 Pozzuoli Campania Italy
Rhegium Acts 28:13 Reggio Calabria Calabria Italy
Smyrna Revelation 2:8 İzmir İzmir Province Turkey
Thessalonica I & II Thessalonians Thessaloniki Central Macedonia Greece
Thyatira Revelation 2:18 Akhisar Manisa Province Turkey

Rashi, who had not seen Josephus' writings, surmised that Ein Etam was the place known as "the waters of Nephtoah" (cf. Rashi's commentary on Yoma 31a and Zevahim 54b, s.v. עין עיטם); see also Rashi's comments on Joshua 15:8 and Deuteronomy 33.

  31. ^ Jerusalem Talmud (Kila'im 9:3; Genesis Rabba § 98:15; not a ruin, per se, but a recognised land feature (i.e. "wine press") known to the ancients, situate some 3 biblical miles from Sepphoris. Marcus Jastrow explains "Gob'batha" as meanings "hills". In J. Payne Smith's A Compendious Syriac Dictionary the word is explained as meaning "a pit, hole, den, cavern." In the Jerusalem Talmud, the name is written in its elided-form, פפתה, instead of גובבתא/גופפתא. The place is said to have been the birthplace of Jonah the prophet.
  32. ^ Rabbi Saadia Gaon's Judeo-Arabic Translation of the word Gerar (Judeo-Arabic: אלכ'לוץ = al-Khalūṣ) in the Pentateuch (Tafsir), s.v. Genesis 10:19, Genesis 20:2, Genesis 26:17, 20. On Haluza's proximity to Gerar, see: M. Naor, Gerar — Tell el Far'a, Bulletin of the Israel Exploration Society (1955), pp. 99–102 (Hebrew)
  33. ^ Victor Guérin, Description de la Palestine, Judée, Description de la Judée, Paris 1869, p. 298; See: Guérin, V. (1869). Description Géographique Historique et Archéologique de la Palestine (in French). 1: Judee, pt. 3. Paris: L'Imprimerie Nationale.  Others identify Giloh with Khirbet Jala, ca. 8 km. (5 mi.) north, northwest of Hebron. See: David Noel Freedman and Allen C. Myers, Eerdmans Dictionary of the Bible, Grand Rapids 2000, p. 505 (s.v. Giloh) ISBN 0-8028-2400-5
  34. ^ Eerdmans Dictionary of the Bible. Wm. B. Eerdmans. 2000. p. 505. ISBN 0-8028-2400-5.

  41. ^ Jerusalem Talmud, Erubin 5:7; Tosefta, Erubin 7:2; cf. Jerusalem Talmud, Megillah 1:1 (2a). Hammath was, originally, an independent town (separate from Rakkath where Tiberias stands), but the suburbs of both towns merged into one. The Jerusalem Talmud mentions that Hammath was within the Sabbath-day walking distance, meaning, less than 1 biblical mile from Tiberias.
  42. ^ "Joshua 19:19 / Hebrew - English Bible / Mechon-Mamre". mechon-mamre.org. 
  43. ^ Thought by Yeshayahu Press, editor of Topographical-Historical Encyclopedia of the Land of Israel, to be the biblical Hapharaim, in the territory given to tribe of Issachar. Ishtori Haparchi, differing in view, thought that the old namesake is represented in the nearby village of Kefrah (see: Ishtori Haparchi, Kaftor u'ferach vol. 2, [3rd edition, published by ed. Avraham Yosef Havatzelet], chapter 11, Jerusalem 2007, p. 63 -- note 144)

Albright, "The Site of Tirzah and the Topography of Western Manasseh", in: The Journal of the Palestine Oriental Society, vol. XI, Jerusalem 1931, p. 248, who says that the Arabic name eṭ Ṭaiyibeh (shortened for Ṭaiyibet al-Ism) was given to the city Ophrah as a euphemism, meaning "the goodly," to offset the name Afrīn which, in Arabic connotation, means "demons" (cf. Annual of the American Schools of Oriental Research [AASOR], IV, pp. 130–ff.; ibid. VI (1926), p. 35; Albrecht Alt, PJB 1926, pp. 68–ff.). Although the meaning of "Ophrah" in Hebrew has nothing to do with its Arabic connotation, nevertheless, such appellations for cities were thought of as being offensive, warranting its name change.
